content: Motivated by PFR through #17308, @David Loeffler and I independently formalised Goursat's lemma. Mine is #18823, David's is #18667

My proof looks more broken down than David's, but his looks like it reuses more existing machinery. Would people like to interject and say which part of the proofs they like best, so that we can combine them into something even better?
Another difference is that mine works for (possible non-abelian) groups, while David's works for modules

I actually think Yael's proof is better than mine. (You can easily recover the statement for modules over an arbitrary ring from the statement for abelian groups; but the generalisation to possibly non-commutative groups, which Yael proves, is significantly stronger.)
